dcterms:creator: M. M. Bronstein
J. Bruna
Y. LeCun
A. Szlam
P. Vandergheynst
dcterms:description: Graph convolutional networks adapt the architecture of convolutional neural networks to learn rich representations of data supported on arbitrary graphs by replacing the convolution operations of convolutional neural networks with graph-dependent linear operations.
dcterms:title: Graph Convolutional Networks

dcterms:creator: Joan Bruna
Wojciech Zaremba
Arthur Szlam
Yann LeCun
dcterms:description: Spectral networks and locally connected networks on graphs are discussed, focusing on the adaptation of convolutional neural networks to graph structures.
dcterms:title: Spectral Networks

dcterms:creator: MichaÃ«l Defferrard
Xavier Bresson
Pierre Vandergheynst
dcterms:description: Convolutional neural networks on graphs with fast localized spectral filtering are proposed, enhancing the efficiency of learning on graph-structured data.
dcterms:title: Convolutional Neural Networks on Graphs

dcterms:creator: F. Grassi
A. Loukas
N. Perraudin
B. Ricaud
dcterms:description: A time-vertex signal processing framework is introduced for scalable processing and meaningful representations for time-series on graphs.
dcterms:title: Time-Vertex Signal Processing Framework

dcterms:creator: A. Sandryhaila
J. M. F. Moura
dcterms:description: Discrete signal processing on graphs is explored, extending traditional signal processing tools to graph-structured data.
dcterms:title: Graph Signal Processing

dcterms:creator: A. Sandryhaila
J. M. F. Moura
dcterms:description: Big data analysis with signal processing on graphs is discussed, focusing on the representation and processing of massive datasets with irregular structure.
dcterms:title: Big Data Analysis with Signal Processing on Graphs

dcterms:creator: A. Loukas
D. Foucard
dcterms:description: Frequency analysis of time-varying graph signals is presented, focusing on the analysis of signals that change over time on graph structures.
dcterms:title: Frequency Analysis of Time-Varying Graph Signals

dcterms:creator: Barry Simon
dcterms:description: Operator theory is discussed, providing a comprehensive course in analysis relevant to the mathematical foundations of signal processing.
dcterms:title: Operator Theory
